brief_description: This study will measure the immune response to the Pneumovax vaccine  The long-term goal is to develop improved vaccines to infectious diseases such as influenza. Blood will be collected from patients at several visits before and after vaccination. The blood will be used in a series of immunological tests to measure the strength and breadth of immune response. These assays may include T cell and B cell activation assays, microarray testing, Epimax, Epigen, and flow cytometry.
brief_title: In-Depth Characterization of Immune Responses to Pneumovax Vaccination in Healthy Subjects
condition_studied: Vaccine responses in healthy adult population.
description: This study will measure the immune response to the Pneumovax vaccine  The long-term goal is to develop improved vaccines to infectious diseases such as influenza. Blood will be collected from patients at several visits before and after vaccination. The blood will be used in a series of immunological tests to measure the strength and breadth of immune response. These assays may include T cell and B cell activation assays, microarray testing, Epimax, Epigen, and flow cytometry.
hypothesis: That immune responses can be measured longitudinally after vaccination and that the information gained may be useful for developing novel vaccines.
objectives: To measure immune responses to vaccination with Pneumovax vaccine in healthy adult subjects.
official_title: In-Depth Characterization of Immune Responses to Pneumovax Vaccination in Healthy Subjects

program.contract_name: Systems Analysis Vaccine Responses in Healthy and Hyporesponsive Humans
